item.title: Prompt design
item.description: Prompting is like web design. Let’s call it prompt design, and build better tools for it.

item.title: Inference characteristics of Llama
item.description: A primer on inference math and an examination of the surprising costs of Llama.

item.title: Our problems
item.description: A list of problems we are excited to solve for Cursor.

item.title: Editing Files at 1000 Tokens per Second
item.description: A new model and inference method for high-accuracy full-file edits at 1000 tokens/s.

item.title: More problems
item.description: Several exciting problem areas for the next phase of AI-programming.

item.title: Series A and Magic
item.description: We’ve raised $60M to create a magical tool with the aim of writing the world’s software.

item.title: Iterating with shadow workspaces
item.description: Hidden windows and kernel-level folder proxies to let AIs iterate on code without affecting the user.

item.title: Supermaven joins Cursor
item.description: We’re teaming up to build the next phase of AI coding.

item.title: Character Prefix Conditioning
item.description: A clever algorithm for more accurate code completion sampling.

item.title: A new Tab model
item.description: Announcing the next-generation Cursor Tab model.

item.title: Series B and Automating Code
item.description: We’ve raised $105M to further our mission of automating code.

item.title: Early team
item.description: Lots of great people are behind Cursor! Here are some.

item.title: Series C and Scale
item.description: We’ve raised $900m to push the frontier of AI coding research.

item.title: Updates to Ultra and Pro
item.description: In collaboration with the model providers, we’re introducing a $200 / mo tier for power users.

item.title: Cursor on web and mobile
item.description: Work with a powerful coding assistant anywhere with the Cursor Agent on web and mobile.

item.title: Clarifying our pricing
item.description: How the new Pro plan works and why we changed our pricing.

item.title: Bugbot is out of beta
item.description: Automatically review your PRs with Bugbot.

item.title: GPT-5 is now available in Cursor
item.description: This is OpenAI's most powerful model, and we've found it to be quite effective for coding.

item.title: Cursor Agent CLI
item.description: You can now use Cursor Agent from the CLI or headless in any environment.

item.title: Updates to Teams and Auto
item.description: Variable requests for teams and competitive pricing for Auto.

item.title: Bringing the Cursor Agent to Linear
item.description: You can now trigger Cursor Background Agents directly from Linear, helping you fix bugs, build features, and respond quickly to user feedback.

item.title: 1.5x faster MoE training with custom MXFP8 kernels
item.description: Achieving a 3.5x MoE layer speedup with a complete rebuild for Blackwell GPUs.

item.title: Improving Cursor Tab with online RL
item.description: Our new Tab model makes 21% fewer suggestions while having 28% higher accept rate.

item.title: Improving Java support in Cursor
item.description: We're speeding up the Java Language Server Protocol (LSP) and VS Code ecosystem.

item.title: Introducing Plan Mode
item.description: Cursor can now create plans, research your codebase, and run agents for significantly longer.

item.title: Introducing Cursor 2.0 and Composer
item.description: A new interface and our first coding model, both purpose-built for working with agents.

item.title: Composer: Building a fast frontier model with RL
item.description: Composer is our new agent model designed for software engineering intelligence and speed.

item.title: Cloud Agents
item.description: Cloud agents make it easy to run many agents at once, without requiring your laptop to stay connected to the internet.

item.title: Introducing Cursor for Enterprise
item.description: Cursor is used by tens of thousands of enterprises, including Salesforce, NVIDIA, and PwC, to accelerate product velocity and build durable software.

item.title: Improving agent with semantic search
item.description: Semantic search significantly improves coding agent performance with 12.5% higher accuracy, improves code retention and decreases dissatisfied user requests.

item.title: The productivity impact of coding agents
item.description: A new study from the University of Chicago finds that companies merge 39% more PRs after Cursor's agent became the default.

item.title: Past, Present, and Future
item.description: We raised our Series D of $2.3B and have passed $1B in annualized revenue.

item.title: Improving Cursor’s agent for OpenAI Codex models
item.description: How we updated our agent harness to support GPT-5.1-Codex-Max.

item.title: Introducing Debug Mode: Agents with runtime logs
item.description: Debug Mode helps you reproduce and fix the most tricky bugs.

item.title: A visual editor for the Cursor Browser
item.description: Bringing design and engineering closer together.

item.title: Graphite is joining Cursor
item.description: Graphite has entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by Cursor.

item.title: Hooks for security and platform teams
item.description: We're partnering with ecosystem vendors who have built hooks support with Cursor.
